text: I love gazpacho soup what's not to love
about it southern Spanish comfort food
is served chilled in the warm weather
months it's chock full of vegetables
primarily tomatoes and I thought hey why
not just skip the blender make a
delicious chopped salad so that's what
we're going to do today
start by making the really really
flavorful vinaigrette so I've graded on
a microplane zester one clove of garlic
use your finger or spatula get all of it
out of the microplane zester
I love grating garlic like this really
finely because it fully fully
incorporates into your vinaigrette to
that add one teaspoon of Dijon mustard
this is going to add a nice amount of
heat and kick but it's also going to
help emulsify our vinaigrette
add one tablespoon of sherry vinegar now
you could use another vinegar here like
champagne or white wine but sherry
vinegar really gives this salad its
signature taste so definitely seek it
out if you can season with a pinch of
salt and pepper and whisk in 1/3 cup
extra virgin olive oil can already smell
that sherry vinegar it is activated and
ready to go nice going to multiply this
is the time to use your higher quality
olive oil if you have one this is such a
simple style you really want all the
flavors to shine give this a taste mean
man it's good kick I'll just set this
over here to the side these are all the
components of our salad we have the
tomatoes bell pepper cucumber bread and
onion let's start with the bell pepper
here I'm using a yellow bell pepper you
could use a red if you'd like the yellow
in the orange I find to be just a little
bit more sweet I will start by taking
out the stem end and then quarter each
side and remove the seeds so the idea
for this salad is that it's a chopped
salad we can keep things kind of on the
coarse side adds a nice texture crunch
we're looking for about 1 inch size
these aren't all ready to go push those
off to the side now for a fun cooling
component 1 mini cucumber here you could
also use about a quarter of a regular
size cucumbers but these are pretty
readily available now and slice into
about half inch moons the idea is that
all these vegetables should be able to
fit on a sportful pretty comfortably
right now tomato time I'm using a
Campari style tomato these are also
sometimes labeled cocktails and the
reason I like using these is that the
skin to seed and flesh ratio is what I'm
looking for in this salad so they're not
super super juicy say like a beefsteak
but they don't have a tremendous amount
of skin say like a cherry tomato this is
the perfect ratio for me and I think
tomatoes are probably the star of this
show and you should definitely be making
the salad at the height of tomato season
big finished last tomato the reason I
like cutting this crosswise is that you
get all the components of the tomato in
one bite last but not least we have two
slices of rustic bread that are just
nicely toasted and slice this into about
half inch cubes so gazpacho is
traditionally thickened with a little
bit of bread or almonds this is like a
really nice little crouton it also helps
soak up all the delicious juices and
vinaigrette I have my palette my blank
slate ready to go let's start with
tomato so I mentioned earlier this is
often made with almonds but you can
serve this with some really delicious
marcona almonds on the side I think it
makes a really awesome
cocktail hour Edition so this is the
type of salad I want to eat when it's
really hot out in the summer and I also
don't feel like spending a lot of time
in the kitchen so you can prepare this
salad and then you can just open up a
can of sardines if you have some grilled
shrimp around that would be awesome too
when all these vegetables are at their
peak
what's about it have been super colorful
salad like this so I'm using a quarter
cup of red diced onion you can also use
sweet onions if you see them in the
market interesting thing that I did here
took the edge off the onion a little bit
I soaked it in ice water for about ten
minutes and then drained it so when
you're using raw onions like this
sometimes it's nice just to kind of
mellow out their flavor that's what the
ice water bath really helps do sprinkle
is in we're going to add our red cube
nice and seedy and craggy alright so
everyone's here let me just give it a
quick season salt a little bit more
pepper and then drizzle with the

type of salad personally I would want to

think it's really just going to make all

you can't wait you can dig right in oh
